{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3131936,"name":"","username":"dejabitz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T19:39:07.241Z","cooked":"

For our robot software, we’d like to be able to deploy static content (eg configuration files of various types) without going through a whole build&deploy cycle for our (java) code. The deployfrcStaticFilesDeploy tasks seem to be made for this, but when we use that to deploy static content, the robot code stops running (eg, the java process is no longer running on the RoboRIO).

Is this expected? If not, any tips for what to dig into as to why the robot code stops running - and/or a companion task that will restart the robot code?

Thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-22T19:39:07.241Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":123,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":645.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56653,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3131946,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T19:52:45.146Z","cooked":"

I can’t say whether it’s expected or not, but I’m curious why youre trying to avoid the build/deploy process. It shouldnt take more than a minute or so, and I’d suspect you need to restart the robot code to pick up the changes anyway.

In any case, you could ssh/scp the files over manually if you wanted to. Thats effectively all that gradle task should be doing anyway.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-22T19:52:45.146Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131959,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T20:28:43.880Z","cooked":"
dejabitz:

without going through a whole build&deploy cycle for our (java) code

For what it’s worth, gradle caches compilation results between runs so if there are no changes to the source code the compilation will not be run.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-22T20:28:43.880Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/3","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3131975,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T20:56:34.945Z","cooked":"

That is the expected behavior. That deploy task is part of the pipeline, where the first thing done is to kill robot code.

The only ways to restart code is to either run the full pipeline, which will run the start robot code command, or hitting restart robot code on the ds should also bring it back.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-22T20:56:34.945Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/4","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3132004,"name":"","username":"dejabitz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T22:37:23.825Z","cooked":"

Thank you all! Ack that running deploy is typically in the ~minute or so range (and builds are cached/incremental), tho we are looking for faster dev cycles. The code on the robot doesn’t need to be restarted to process these new files.

The use case is to separate various parameters - CAN bus IDs, PID values, potentially input like waypoint locations - from the application code. We would also like to have these configuration files under version control, so we had been looking to use the deploy directory for this.

For the PID tuning case in particular, the students would benefit from fast dev cycles.

Do you have any recommendations for how to achieve this? Based on this thread, one thought is to have a tool that allows for both saving files in the source tree and pushing code (through an API we build) directly to the RoboRIO. Are there best practices team follow for this kind of use case?

Thank you!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-22T22:37:23.825Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":31.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56653,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3132006,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-22T22:49:36.413Z","cooked":"

Digging through the code, I realized there an easy enough way to move that deploy to happen first.

Add the following line to the frcStaticFileDeploy block.
setDeployStage(it, 'BeforeProgramKill')

That will cause that static file deploy task to run in the first stage of the pipeline, which happens before the program is killed.

For reference the stages are here, and run in the order listed.

github.com

wpilibsuite/GradleRIO/blob/main/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/gradlerio/deploy/DeployStage.java

package edu.wpi.first.gradlerio.deploy;

public enum DeployStage {
    BeforeProgramKill,
    ProgramKill,
    AfterProgramKill,
    FileRetreival,
    FileDeploy,
    BeforeProgramStart,
    ProgramStart,
    AfterProgramStart
}

You could just ssh into the roboRIO and copy the file. Or for that matter just edit it on the roboRIO. Or use something like WinSCP to copy it over. Keep the WinSCP session open and click upload (F5) after saving the file locally. Finally, WinSCP allows you to use a local text editor to edit a remote file (on the roboRIO in this case).

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

roboRIO User Accounts and SSH

The roboRIO image contains a number of accounts, this article will highlight the two used for FRC and provide some detail about their purpose. It will also describe how to connect to the roboRIO ov...

Thank you - that worked!

To make sure I’m following, only the last stage needed for the task(s)/deps you specify will be run, so setting the stage to BeforeProgramKill for a specific task and running just that task will not proceed to any of the subsequent stages?

Minor - FileRetreival is misspelled (likely too late to change?).

Thank you so much for your time and help!

We use the Preferences class to tune parameters on the fly. We then set the default preference value in the code so that it’s in source control.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-01-23T15:52:27.520Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":25.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/basic-programming/robot-preferences.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Setting Robot Preferences — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":9}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56653,"username":"dejabitz","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/edb3f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3262198,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-12-08T18:58:21.988Z","cooked":"
Original

Sorry to bring up this old thread, but I am looking to do something similar, but different. I to want to use the Preferences class to save settings on the robot, but we had the robot lose the table once. The OP wanted the code to be the “primary” data source for the configs to version control it, but I would like the robots to be the primary. Things like swerve offsets and CAN ids should be specific to the robot, not the code (just make it Constants in the Java file if you want it common to all).

So, I would like to backup that file on code deploys. I agree that I could SCP in to the Rio and pull it on occasion, but that means I have to remember to do that on occasion, and I’m forgetful. I think it should be a straightforward Gradle command (on code deploy, download file from robot, maybe even change filename with the date to have a history of the revisions).

The use case would be either a Rio swap, or a loss of file system. (we did a code deploy in 2022, and somehow it deleted the networktables.json between quals and playoffs, and it was a panic reconstruct the table) By having a backup of the json file, we could redeploy it with SCP or a dashboard and reconstruct the table easily.

Also, while the SCP method to get/set the files works 99% of the time, it shouldn’t work on the field, as they block port 22 on the field. If we had to redeploy a config on a field because the Rio lost it, we would have to do it through a dashboard instead (Shuffleboard has a nice box to do that with).

Edit: I thought about this more, I don’t know if my request is needed anymore. Since we use WpiLib logging files, we can just pull the data from the log files in case of emergency. Then an occasional SCP pull/push of the configuration should be sufficient.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-12-08T20:18:56.386Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":49,"readers_count":48,"score":9.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"Steven Carmain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1737,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/10","custom_user_title":"Programmer/Drive Coach","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3270736,"name":"","username":"dejabitz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-01T00:42:19.182Z","cooked":"

Thanks - interesting idea to flip the primary/backup around. That could work.

From my perspective, the problem to solve is:
a) allow for quick, no-code edit/build/deploy cycle required for tuning like PID values while
b) ensuring that the RoboRio isn’t the only place where these values are stored.

Preferences seems like a natural and established way to handle a). If we could set up a sync of the file Preferences uses to read and store values between the RoboRio and the robot source tree (almost an inverse of the deploy directory), that could accomplish b).

What would be involved in writing a GradleRIO rule to pull the Preferences file(s) from the robot to some part of the source tree?

Thank you!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-01-01T00:42:19.182Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424351,"topic_slug":"deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56653,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/deploying-static-files-via-gradlerio-stops-robot-code/424351/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3270737,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-01T00:50:28.557Z","cooked":"

There’s nothing built into gradlerio to allow pulling files. It’s actually something I’m working on for the 2025 season, but it requires using a new ssh library which we don’t want to switch to this late.

You can ssh in manually and pull the files, and Call console ssh commands from gradle if you want, you can look up the standard gradle documentation for how to execute console commands.
